what: Highlight Conserved Edits Across Versions of a Document
title: Highlight Conserved Edits Across Versions of a Document
text: package can used create highlighted source document based frequency phrases found single multiple note sheets. goal method indicate portions source document individuals felt worth copying notes, based phrase frequency. inputs necessary procedure notes document source document. output HTML code generating highlighted text.

title: Highlight Conserved Edits Across Versions of a Document
text: can install CRAN : can install development version highlightr GitHub :
code: install.packages("highlightr") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("rachelesrogers/highlightr")

title: Highlight Conserved Edits Across Versions of a Document
text: page_highlight produce HTML output can rendered highlighted text. can done R Markdown specifying object outside code chunk `r page_highlight`, knitting document HTML. Alternatively, xml2 package can used save output html file, shown following code: image generated resulting html output (seen vignette("highlightr")).
code: # load library library(highlightr)  # rename desired column of derivative documents to 'page_notes' comment_example_rename <- dplyr::rename(comment_example, page_notes=Notes)  # tokenize derivative documents toks_comment <- token_comments(comment_example_rename)  # rename desired column of source document to 'text' transcript_example_rename <- dplyr::rename(transcript_example, text=Text)  # tokenize source document toks_transcript <- token_transcript(transcript_example_rename)  # use fuzzy matching in collocation collocation_object <- collocate_comments_fuzzy(toks_transcript, toks_comment) #> Warning in join_func(a = a, b = b, by_a = by_a, by_b = by_b, block_by_a = block_by_a, : A pair of records at the threshold (0.7) have only a 95% chance of being compared. #> Please consider changing `n_bands` and `band_width`.  # connect collocation frequencies to source document merged_frequency <- transcript_frequency(transcript_example_rename, collocation_object)  # create `ggplot` object of the transcript freq_plot <- collocation_plot(merged_frequency)  # add html tags to source document page_highlight <- highlighted_text(freq_plot) page_highlight # load `xml2` library  library(xml2)  # save html output to desired location  xml2::write_html(xml2::read_html(page_highlight), "filename.html")

title: Collocation of Comments — collocate_comments
text: function provides frequency collocations comments correspond provided transcript.

title: Collocation of Comments — collocate_comments
code: collocate_comments(transcript_token, note_token, collocate_length = 5)

title: Collocation of Comments — collocate_comments
text: transcript_token transcript token act baseline notes, resulting token_transcript() note_token tokenized document notes, resulting token_comments() collocate_length length collocation. Default 5

title: Collocation of Comments — collocate_comments
text: data frame transcript corresponding note frequency

title: Collocation of Comments — collocate_comments
text: Collocations sequences words present source document. example, phrase "blue bird flies" contains one collocation length 4 ("blue bird flies"), two collocations length 3 ("blue bird" "blue bird flies"), three collocations length 2 ("blue", "blue bird", "bird flies"). function counts number corresponding phrases 'notes', derivative documents. Matches two documents must exact

title: Collocation of Comments — collocate_comments
code: # Rename relevant column to page_notes in the derivative document comment_example_rename <- dplyr::rename(comment_example, page_notes=Notes) # Tokenize the derivative document toks_comment <- token_comments(comment_example_rename[1:100,]) # Rename relevant column in the source document to text transcript_example_rename <- dplyr::rename(transcript_example, text=Text) # Tokenize source document toks_transcript <- token_transcript(transcript_example_rename) # Compute collocation frequencies collocation_object <- collocate_comments(toks_transcript, toks_comment) #> Joining with `by = join_by(tolower.unlist.descript_ngrams..)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(collocation)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(word_number)`

title: Collocate Comments Fuzzy — collocate_comments_fuzzy
text: function provides frequency collocations comments correspond provided transcript, using fuzzy matching.

title: Collocate Comments Fuzzy — collocate_comments_fuzzy
code: collocate_comments_fuzzy(   transcript_token,   note_token,   collocate_length = 5,   n_bands = 50,   threshold = 0.7,   n_gram_width = 4 )

title: Collocate Comments Fuzzy — collocate_comments_fuzzy
text: transcript_token transcript token act baseline notes, resulting token_transcript() note_token tokenized document notes, resulting token_comments() collocate_length length collocation. Default 5 n_bands number bands used MinHash algorithm passed zoomerjoin::jaccard_right_join(). Default 50 threshold Jaccard distance threshold considered match passed zoomerjoin::jaccard_right_join(). Default 0.7 n_gram_width width n-grams used Jaccard distance calculation passed zoomerjoin::jaccard_right_join(). Default 4

title: Collocate Comments Fuzzy — collocate_comments_fuzzy
text: data frame transcript corresponding note frequency

title: Collocate Comments Fuzzy — collocate_comments_fuzzy
text: Collocations sequences words present source document. example, phrase "blue bird flies" contains one collocation length 4 ("blue bird flies"), two collocations length 3 ("blue bird" "blue bird flies"), three collocations length 2 ("blue", "blue bird", "bird flies"). function counts number corresponding phrases 'notes', derivative documents. Due fuzzy matching, indirect matches included weight (n*d)/m, n frequency fuzzy collocation, d Jaccard similarity transcript note collocation, m number closest matches note collocation.

title: Collocate Comments Fuzzy — collocate_comments_fuzzy
code: # Rename relevant column to page_notes in the derivative document comment_example_rename <- dplyr::rename(comment_example[1:10,], page_notes=Notes) # Tokenize the derivative document toks_comment <- token_comments(comment_example_rename) # Rename relevant column in the source document to text transcript_example_rename <- dplyr::rename(transcript_example, text=Text) # Tokenize source document toks_transcript <- token_transcript(transcript_example_rename) # Compute collocation frequencies using fuzzy (or indirect) matching fuzzy_object <- collocate_comments_fuzzy(toks_transcript, toks_comment) #> Joining with `by = join_by(unlist.descript_ngrams.)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(collocation)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(collocation)` #> Warning: A pair of records at the threshold (0.7) have only a 95% chance of being compared. #> Please consider changing `n_bands` and `band_width`. #> Joining with `by = join_by(collocation.y)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(collocation)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(word_number)`

what: Map collocation to ggplot object — collocation_plot
title: Map collocation to ggplot object — collocation_plot
text: assigns colors based frequency words transcript.

title: Map collocation to ggplot object — collocation_plot
code: collocation_plot(   frequency_doc,   n_scenario = 1,   colors = c("#f251fc", "#f8ff1b") )

title: Map collocation to ggplot object — collocation_plot
text: frequency_doc document frequencies (returned transcript_frequency()) n_scenario number scenarios transcript appeared. Defualt 1 colors list color specification gradient. Default c("#f251fc","#f8ff1b")

title: Map collocation to ggplot object — collocation_plot
text: list plot, plot object, frequency

title: Map collocation to ggplot object — collocation_plot
code: # Rename relevant column to page_notes in the derivative document comment_example_rename <- dplyr::rename(comment_example, page_notes=Notes) # Tokenize the derivative document toks_comment <- token_comments(comment_example_rename) # Rename relevant column in the source document to text transcript_example_rename <- dplyr::rename(transcript_example, text=Text) # Tokenize source document toks_transcript <- token_transcript(transcript_example_rename) # Compute collocation frequencies collocation_object <- collocate_comments(toks_transcript, toks_comment) #> Joining with `by = join_by(tolower.unlist.descript_ngrams..)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(collocation)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(word_number)` # Merge frequencies with source document to provide averages by word and correct formatting merged_frequency <- transcript_frequency(transcript_example_rename, collocation_object) #> Joining with `by = join_by(to_merge)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(text, lines, n_words, words, word_num, word_length, #> x_coord, to_merge, stanza_freq, word_number)` # Create a plot object to assign colors based on frequency freq_plot <- collocation_plot(merged_frequency)

title: Create Highlighted Testimony — highlighted_text
text: Adds html tags create highlighted testimony corresponding word frequency. render correctly, object produced highlighted_text() can added outside code chunk .Rmd document `r highlighted_text()` format. Alternatively, html output can saved using xml2 package follows: xml2::write_html(xml2::read_html(highlighted_text(), "filepath.html"))

title: Create Highlighted Testimony — highlighted_text
code: highlighted_text(plot_object, labels = c("", ""))

title: Create Highlighted Testimony — highlighted_text
text: plot_object plot object resulting collocation_plot() labels lower upper labels gradient scale

title: Create Highlighted Testimony — highlighted_text
text: html code highlighted text

title: Create Highlighted Testimony — highlighted_text
code: # Rename relevant column to page_notes in the derivative document comment_example_rename <- dplyr::rename(comment_example, page_notes=Notes) # Tokenize the derivative document toks_comment <- token_comments(comment_example_rename) # Rename relevant column in the source document to text transcript_example_rename <- dplyr::rename(transcript_example, text=Text) # Tokenize source document toks_transcript <- token_transcript(transcript_example_rename) # Compute collocation frequencies collocation_object <- collocate_comments(toks_transcript, toks_comment) #> Joining with `by = join_by(tolower.unlist.descript_ngrams..)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(collocation)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(word_number)` # Merge frequencies with source document to provide averages by word and correct formatting merged_frequency <- transcript_frequency(transcript_example_rename, collocation_object) #> Joining with `by = join_by(to_merge)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(text, lines, n_words, words, word_num, word_length, #> x_coord, to_merge, stanza_freq, word_number)` # Create a plot object to assign colors based on frequency freq_plot <- collocation_plot(merged_frequency) # Add html tags to create a highlighted version of the source document page_highlight <- highlighted_text(freq_plot, merged_frequency)

title: Mapping Collocation Frequency to Transcript Document — transcript_frequency
code: # Rename relevant column to page_notes in the derivative document comment_example_rename <- dplyr::rename(comment_example, page_notes=Notes) # Tokenize the derivative document toks_comment <- token_comments(comment_example_rename) # Rename relevant column in the source document to text transcript_example_rename <- dplyr::rename(transcript_example, text=Text) # Tokenize source document toks_transcript <- token_transcript(transcript_example_rename) # Compute collocation frequencies collocation_object <- collocate_comments(toks_transcript, toks_comment) #> Joining with `by = join_by(tolower.unlist.descript_ngrams..)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(collocation)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(word_number)` # Merge frequencies with source document to provide averages by word and correct formatting merged_frequency <- transcript_frequency(transcript_example_rename, collocation_object) #> Joining with `by = join_by(to_merge)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(text, lines, n_words, words, word_num, word_length, #> x_coord, to_merge, stanza_freq, word_number)`

title: highlightr 1.2.0
text: Providing instructions save highlighted output .html file Correcting wiki_pages description correct number rows Listing packages necessary creating wiki_pages object Adding option specify n-gram width collocate_comments_fuzzy Adding comments example scripts description collocation functions

title: highlightr 1.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2025-06-26 Remove dependency fuzzyjoin package, use zoomerjoin package instead Change Levenshtein distance calculation fuzzy joins Jaccard distance Re-compute fuzzy weights based new distance calculation

title: highlightr 1.0.2
text: CRAN release: 2024-10-17 Clarified wording vignettes Fixed computation issue collocations length 5 Fixed merge issue special characters Replaced non-ascii characters datasets

title: highlightr 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-07-31 Initial CRAN submission.
